result.execSummary:
The defendant John D Zonta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John D Zonta is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John D Zonta was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • John D Zonta was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. If after 18 mo def has successfully completed probation and paid all costs, then def can petition for early release from probation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with ES.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.
All other conditions are the same as count 3.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
ADA Sattler moves to orally amend violation date on ct 3 to 2/14/15. Judgment of conviction prepared.
deadline for rebuttal witness list from State extended to allow for parties to continue negotiations. All other dates remain the same.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John D Zonta in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Sattler requests a Ludwig hearing.  ADA Sattler states offer on record. Offer for plea to 2 counts of disorderly conduct for a probation sentence. Defn. rejects offer.  Motion hearing re: Defense Motion regarding other acts filed with the court 1-6-2017.  Ct. finds that  #1,7,12,17 & 24 will not be allowed. Also statements made to defn that will be excluded are 1 and 3 listed in that last paragraph of statements (statements regarding defns father).  Ct. grants the remaining defense other act motion.
Ct. orders that the State will need to disclose rebuttal witnesses regarding other acts evidence by 3-6-17.
for other acts of evidence; filed by Atty Eisenberg
Status conference on April 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on February 16, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John D Zonta in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Ex. 1 & 2 marked prior to hearing. Hearing regarding defense expert testimony. Dr. Fisher will testify at trial with some things that will be excluded.  Ct. will set a hearing to hear what other acts will or will not be allowed at trial.
State's renewed objection to the defense's doctor testimony and new objection to their Motion in Limine; filed by ADA Sattler
Motion hearing on December 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Counsel was in court regarding a different case/different defendant and requested a motion hearing regarding experts be set on this case and trial dates be set over. Ct. grants request. Parties also indicate only 2 days will be needed for trial.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John D Zonta in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Hearing to discuss the defense's use of their expert Dr. Fischer and State's objection to Dr. Fischer.  Atty Eisenberg makes argument regarding the State not providing list of expert or rebuttal expert to defense expert and not meeting timelines set by Ct. Atty Eisenberg argues that rebuttal expert should not be allowed due to missing timeline.  Ct. denies request for denial of rebuttal expert. ADA Sattler argues that she can not respond to use of defense expert because she does not know what expert will testify about and a Daubert hearing may be necessary. ADA Sattler requests for clarification of what expert will be testifying about.  Atty Eisenberg requests time to supplement his submissions regarding their expert.  Atty Eisenberg indicates this will not be a N.G.I. Atty Eisenberg will do so by 8-19-2016.  ADA Sattler will provide response by 9-7-2016.  Atty Eisenberg requests that if his expert needs to testify can she appear by phone.  Ct. grants that request. Ct. will cancel 9-7-2016 motion hearing at this time.
Status conference on August 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
from DA's office objecting to testimony of Dr. Karla Fischer
Def's Expert's report by Dr. Karla Fisher
Status conference on September 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 7, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John D Zonta in court with attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Eisenberg indicates he will need a trial date in October due to availability of his expert.  Atty Eisenberg is requesting a motion hearing prior to trial regarding expert testimony. ADA Sattler objects to expert Atty Eisenberg is referencing at this time due to not receiving any expert reports and this expert was not on Atty Eisenberg's notice of expert witnesses. State to identify experts to defense by 6-24-2016.  State's expert report to be provided by 7-26-2016.  Ct orders defense's expert(Carla Fisher) report be provided to the State by 5-25-2016.
Status conference on May 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
for Continuance of trial from Atty Eisenburg - Motion Granted

Status conference at 11-02-2015 01:30 pm

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Elizabeth S. except as ordered in Dane County case number 2014FA367. 
- Defendant shall not be at the residence of Elizabeth S.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
